data.name: Type-level  TypeScript: Array.prototype.map
data.description:
You're probably familiar with [`Array.prototype.map`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/map), but can you do the same with types? In this series of kata, you will be solving problems purely in the type system. Let's say you have a type `Foo`:

```ts
type Foo<T> = { foo: T };
```

How would you map a tuple of values to `Foo`?

```ts
type Result = MapWithFoo<[1, 2, 3]>; // [Foo<1>, Foo<2>, Foo<3>]
```

Basically, you want to do this:

```ts
const result = [1, 2, 3].map((t) => foo(t));
```

but at the type-level!

*Notes: must work for tuples an arrays, and input to your type can be readonly*

[*Hint if needed*](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/2/mapped-types.html)
